question: What is the initial corpus of National Infrastructure investment fund(NIIF) ?
explanation: The government had set up NIIF with an initial corpus of â‚¹40,000 crore in 2015. It was set up as an investment vehicle mainly for funding commercially viable greenfield, brownfield and stalled infrastructure projects. The Indian government is investing 49% and the rest of the corpus is to be raised from third-party investors such as sovereign wealth funds, insurance and pension funds, endowments, etc.
